question: Which of the following is NOT correct about units of work:
explanation:
Joule is the absolute unit of work in S.I 1 joule = 1 Nm
  • 1 joule= 107 ergs (erg is the unit of work in c.g.s)
  • 1 erg = 1 dyne cm
  • Also, Kilogram-metre (kg-m) is the gravitational unit of work on S.I 1 kg-m = 9.8 j
